byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and ABBY GOODNOUGH

abstract: Instability in health insurance marketplaces created by Affordable Care Act, including in markets in many states, is providing fodder for arguments of both detractors, who want to shrink federal role in healthcare, and supporters who want to expand it.
lead_paragraph: Insurers’ struggles in marketplaces created by the Affordable Care Act have emboldened both conservatives who want to shrink the federal role and liberals who want to expand it.

headline.main: Instability in Marketplaces Draws Concern on Both Sides of Health Law
headline.print_headline: Instability in Marketplaces Draws Concern on Both Sides of Health Law

snippet: Insurers’ struggles in marketplaces created by the Affordable Care Act have emboldened both conservatives who want to shrink the federal role and liberals who want to expand it.
